If you use [Pixi](https://pixi.sh/), you can create a new isolated environment
with the available conda package:

```bash
pixi init -c umccr -c conda-forge ./tidy_env
cd ./tidy_env
pixi add r-tidywigits==X.X.X
```

Then you can create a task to run the `tidywigits.R` CLI script:

```bash
pixi task add tw "tidywigits.R"
pixi run tw --help
```

Or activate the environment and use tidywigits directly in an R environment:

```bash
pixi shell
R
```

```r
library(tidywigits)
```
